page.title: 13Shopping in Wheelock 1
page.content: Mrs Grimes talking to us about shops then and now has lived in the village for 72 years,all her life.When she came to her greengrocers shop,18 years ago it was just a house. She had it made into a shop and lived there with her husband and daughter.When she first had a shop she shared a shop with Mrs Parks who had a haberdashers. The village shops then were Darlingtons the grocers,Rodens had the butchers followed by Cooks and Dennis Thorley.The paper shop was in the same place but the Post Office was on the other side of the bridge until the bomb dropped.The SPAR shop was Bullocks the bakers, and they baked their own bread, cakes and pies. There were two chip-shops, two more shops which sold groceries and sweets and a wool an baby shop owned by a lady called Jean.
